docs.title: Products
docs.text: • MobileForge

docs.title: MobileForge
docs.text: MobileForge is Credeau's mobile development platform designed to streamline the creation and deployment of mobile applications.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Modular architecture
  • Scalable deployment options
  • Support for MongoDB and PostgreSQL databases

Explore the sections below to learn more about MobileForge's components, deployment strategies, scaling guidelines, and data schemas.

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
MobileForge consists of the following core components:

  • Authentication Service: Manages user authentication and authorization.
  • API Gateway: Routes requests to appropriate services.
  • Data Service: Handles data storage and retrieval.
  • Notification Service: Sends push notifications to users.

Each component is designed to be modular and can be scaled independently.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: MobileForge supports horizontal and vertical scaling to accommodate varying workloads.

docs.title: Scaling Strategies
docs.text:
• Horizontal Scaling: Add more instances of services to distribute load.
  • Vertical Scaling: Increase resources (CPU, RAM) of existing instances.

docs.title: Resource Provisioning
docs.text:
• Monitor system metrics to determine scaling needs.
  • Use container orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes) for automated scaling.

docs.title: users
docs.text:
• _id: ObjectId
  • username: String
  • email: String
  • created_at: DateTime

docs.title: sessions
docs.text:
• _id: ObjectId
  • user_id: ObjectId (Reference to users)
  • token: String
  • expires_at: DateTime

docs.title: Indexes
docs.text:
• users.email: Unique
  • sessions.token: Unique

docs.title: users
docs.text:
• id: SERIAL PRIMARY KEY
  • username: VARCHAR(50)
  • email: VARCHAR(100)
  • created_at: TIMESTAMP

docs.title: sessions
docs.text:
• id: SERIAL PRIMARY KEY
  • user_id: INTEGER REFERENCES users(id)
  • token: VARCHAR(255)
  • expires_at: TIMESTAMP

docs.title: Indexes
docs.text:
• users_email_idx on users(email)
  • sessions_token_idx on sessions(token)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The development environment is intended for active development and integration.

docs.title: Setup Instructions
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository.
  2. Install dependencies using pip install -r requirements.txt.
  3. Configure environment variables as specified in .env.development.
  4. Run the application using python manage.py runserver.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Connect to development instances of external services.
  • Use the development database for data persistence.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The production environment is the live environment accessible by end-users.

docs.title: Setup Instructions
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository.
  2. Install dependencies using pip install -r requirements.txt.
  3. Configure environment variables as specified in .env.production.
  4. Use a production-ready web server (e.g., Gunicorn) to run the application.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Ensure all services are properly secured.
  • Monitor application performance and logs.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The testing environment is used for internal testing and quality assurance.

docs.title: Setup Instructions
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository.
  2. Install dependencies using pip install -r requirements.txt.
  3. Configure environment variables as specified in .env.testing.
  4. Run the application using python manage.py runserver.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Use mock services for external dependencies.
  • Enable verbose logging for debugging.
